extendedInfo.description: Easily perform a reverse lookup of any unknown number in your call history(or entered manually).After caller info is found, user can save contact, dial number, block future calls, map location,and more. If you have any trouble, please read the Notes and FAQ section below and if it doesn't answer your question, please email us. We are always happy to help, but we can't respond to reviews.======================================NOTES:â¢ There are NO fees associated with this app whatsoever. A recent review claimed that the app charges your carrier.. this is FALSE.â¢ There is no public directory for cellphones, so we cannot get much data on them, sorry.â¢ This app returns *publicly available data as published by phone companies*.â¢ If information returned is outdated, it's because it's outdated in the phone company's directory.â¢ The location being returned is typically the billing address or carrier's office for that number. It is not possible to return GPS data.â¢ CITY ID must be disabled for this app to work correctly.. it hijacks your call log! See our site for details.======================================PERMISSIONS:â¢INTERNET - required to reach lookup databasesâ¢READ CONTACTS / WRITE CONTACTS - read is used to filter out known numbers from being listed as well as determining which numbers to show a notification for. write is used to create "send to voicemail" contactsâ¢CALL PHONE - for one click calling after a lookup is completeâ¢READ PHONE STATE - used to create notifications when an unknown number calls(if set in preferences)â¢NETWORK STATE - to ensure you have a data connection when using the appâ¢GET ACCOUNTS - used to attach "send to voicemail" contacts to your primary Google account(required for the setting to work). old method of creating these contacts did not require this permission but that did not work on some devices.======================================Frequently Asked Questions: Q: How do I enter a number manually?A: Android 2.x: choose the manual entry option from the menu on the main screen. Android 4.x: press the PHONE icon in the Action Bar on the app's main screen. IMAGE: http://i.imgur.com/dMZTZ.pngQ: How do I get the call list in the app to update?A: Each time the app launches, it pulls the latest applicable numbers from your call log. If you have a phone with lots of RAM, it will update less frequently. To make sure it is always updated, exit the app by using your phones BACK button. This will kill the app each time, and when you use it next time it will launch fresh and update your numbers. (in newer versions of the app, the refresh button at the top will usually do the job!)Q: How do I unblock a number that I blocked with the app?A: Open your contacts list, scroll to the bottom and you will find all the numbers you blocked with the app listed with the prefix zzBlocked. Just find the number youâd like to unblock and delete the contact that goes with it. Storing blocked numbers this way allows them to be blocked at the system level, which is the most consistent way to catch them. If you don't see the zzBlocked contacts listed, press your menu key and make sure you are viewing "All contacts".Q: Only outgoing numbers are shown on the app's main screen..A: If you have a Verizon phone, you most likely have City ID installed. This software hijacks your call log and it must be disabled in order for Reverse Lookup to work properly. See our website for info.Q: I'm getting results that are showing the wrong phone carrier.A: If a number gets ported to another carrier, it usually remains listed as being serviced by the original carrier. kw city id - name id

reviews.title: Works Great
reviews.comment: Gives good info on calls, then lets you go directly to Google lookup about the number to see comments from others about the number.   I also use it for manual lookup of calls to home phone; just wish it would store those number in its stored list.
reviews.author: Bill Thygerson

reviews.title: Excellent!!
reviews.comment: This application is awesome.  I\'ve been able to find out the identity of phone numbers that have really been harassing me.  Telemarketing on your cell is just ridiculous. I don\'t give my number out to hardly anyone, so I really don\'t like getting bothered with unknown and/or unauthorized calls on my cell.  This application has really helped me out.  Highly recommend!!
reviews.author: Lori Linard

reviews.title: Use it all the time. Works pretty well.
reviews.comment: Works well. Sometimes it doesn\'t have info on the number you are looking up, but that\'s life.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Number guru s better
reviews.comment: Number guru gives more information and works faster. I can never find the info I need with this app.
reviews.author: John Adams

reviews.title: Love it
reviews.comment: So I have tried so many of these reverse look up apps.  This one is hands down the best. I giving it five stars. Because of the notification preferences.  Why don\'t handset makers just make this type of app built in?
reviews.author: Lee Ferguson

reviews.title: Not so good
reviews.comment: I input a business number, it came back with the number non published, when I know it IS published. City and carrier correct, thus 3/5 is fair.
reviews.author: Michael Strehl

reviews.title: Sticks.
reviews.comment: Just sticks searching and I have to force close I looked up a few numbers but every one of them were unavailable and unlisted even the NINTENDO support is unknown and unavailable. ..hmm is the info that you get (if any) really true?  But it is the best reverse look up app out there!
reviews.author: Nickie Banda

reviews.title: Better than expected
reviews.comment: Gives details and options. I like that it can reroute the call to voicemail next time if you wanted.
reviews.author: Lindsay Cooper

reviews.title: Seems okay
reviews.comment: Not really detailed enough. I am tempted to buy this app to see what else is there but I won\'t be doing that. I would rather see a full version trial with  usage limits. Uninstalling.
reviews.author: Adam Van

reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment: Good
reviews.author: Ruben Matos

reviews.title: Crap
reviews.comment: It does nothing for unlisted or cell numbers so its kind of useless
reviews.author: peter samgour

reviews.comment: Cool.
reviews.author: Checkina Coulibaly

reviews.title: Works ok
reviews.comment: I can\'t view blocked calls from today. It shows calls that weren\'t blocked. However it is free and it did unmask old blocked numbers
reviews.author: Breanna Dukes

reviews.title: Terrible
reviews.comment: Every number I looked up it had no idea who it was. Finally gave up. Uninstalling and going back to Mr. Number!!
reviews.author: Simone Wade

reviews.title: Reverse lookup
reviews.comment: Wow A-mazing!!! Right away on it\'s own it popped up the unrecognized calls,  gave the name and address,  then showed how to get there,  it even directed what to do if they call again.  Never seen anything like it!!!
reviews.author: Lori Peasley

reviews.title: Samsung note 2
reviews.comment: Great app love it my son and daughter for a pom wondering around got the number off the tag it gave me the owners name and address to get her back home safe.
reviews.author: Stephanie McCloud

reviews.title: GREAT APP!
reviews.comment: Wouldnt be without this app
reviews.author: Karen Falls

reviews.title: Trip
reviews.comment: Found out my line is thru the police station
reviews.author: S SALINAS

reviews.title: It really works!!
reviews.comment: This app saved my butt big time! ! I joined a dating website and this girl came on to me in a weird way and gave me her number.  Low and behold it was a number used before by someone who was using fake profiles!  Thanks guys
reviews.author: Sergio Gutierrez

reviews.title: Nice
reviews.comment: It\'s nice to quickly get info on numbers on the fly.
reviews.author: Marcus Jett
